1.name: Yankee Doodle Dandy
1.description: The life of the renowned musical composer, playwright, actor, dancer, and singer George M. Cohan.

2.name: Casablanca
2.description: A cynical American expatriate struggles to decide whether or not he should help his former lover and her fugitive husband escape French Morocco.

3.name: Gentleman Jim
3.description: As bareknuckled boxing enters the modern era, brash extrovert Jim Corbett uses new rules and dazzlingly innovative footwork to rise to the top of the top of the boxing world.

4.name: Bambi
4.description: The story of a young deer growing up in the forest.

5.name: Mrs. Miniver
5.description: A British family struggles to survive the first months of World War II.

6.name: The Magnificent Ambersons
6.description: The spoiled young heir to the decaying Amberson fortune comes between his widowed mother and the man she has always loved.

7.name: Moontide
7.description: After a drunken binge on the San Pablo waterfront, longshoreman Bobo fears he may have killed a man. In his uncertainty, he takes a job on an isolated bait barge. That night, he rescues ...                See full summary »

8.name: To Be or Not to Be
8.description: During the Nazi occupation of Poland, an acting troupe becomes embroiled in a Polish soldier's efforts to track down a German spy.

9.name: Cat People
9.description: An American man marries a Serbian immigrant who fears that she will turn into the cat person of her homeland's fables if they are intimate together.

10.name: For Me and My Gal
10.description: Two vaudeville performers fall in love, but find their relationship tested by the arrival of WWI.

11.name: Now, Voyager
11.description: A frumpy spinster blossoms under therapy and becomes an elegant, independent woman.

12.name: Random Harvest
12.description: An amnesiac World War I veteran falls in love with a music hall star, only to suffer an accident which restores his original memories but erases his post-war life.

13.name: Holiday Inn
13.description: At an inn which is only open on holidays, a crooner and a hoofer vie for the affections of a beautiful up-and-coming performer.

14.name: The Glass Key
14.description: A crooked politician finds himself being accused of murder by a gangster from whom he refused help during a re-election campaign.

15.name: The Spoilers
15.description: In Nome, Alaska, miner Roy Glennister and his partner Dextry, financed by saloon entertainer Cherry Malotte, fight to save their gold claim from crooked commissioner Alexander McNamara.

16.name: Saboteur
16.description: An aircraft factory worker goes on the run after being wrongly accused of starting a fire that killed his best friend.

17.name: This Gun for Hire
17.description: When assassin Philip Raven shoots a blackmailer and his beautiful female companion dead, he is paid off in marked bills by his treasonous employer who is working with foreign spies.

18.name: The Pride of the Yankees
18.description: The story of the life and career of famed baseball player Lou Gehrig.

19.name: The Ox-Bow Incident
19.description: When a posse captures three men suspected of killing a local farmer, they become strongly divided over whether or not to lynch the men.

20.name: Jungle Book
20.description: A boy raised by wolves tries to adapt to human village life.

21.name: The Talk of the Town
21.description: An escaped prisoner and a stuffy law professor vie for the hand of a spirited schoolteacher.

22.name: In Which We Serve
22.description: This "story of a ship", the British destroyer H.M.S. Torrin, is told in flashbacks by survivors as they cling to a life raft.

23.name: I Married a Witch
23.description: A beautiful 17th-century witch returns to life to plague politician Wallace Wooley, descendant of her persecutor.

24.name: Kings Row
24.description: The dark side and hypocrisy of provincial American life is seen through the eyes of five children as they grow to adulthood at the turn-of-the-century.

25.name: The Major and the Minor
25.description: A woman disguises herself as a child to save on a train fare and is taken in charge by an army man who doesn't notice the truth.

26.name: In This Our Life
26.description: The day before her wedding, a pampered young woman absconds with her sister's husband; in retaliation, her sister begins seeing the woman's former fiancé.

27.name: Woman of the Year
27.description: Rival reporters Sam and Tess fall in love and get married, only to find their relationship strained when Sam comes to resent Tess' hectic lifestyle.

28.name: You Were Never Lovelier
28.description: In Buenos Aires, a man who has decreed that his daughters must marry in order of age allows an American dancer to perform at his club under the condition that he play suitor to his second-oldest daughter.

29.name: The Black Swan
29.description: An ex-pirate contends with rowdy buccaneers and a love-hate relationship with an aristocratic woman who's tougher than she seems.

30.name: The Palm Beach Story
30.description: An inventor needs cash to develop his big idea. His wife, who loves him, decides to raise it for him by divorcing him and marrying a millionaire.

31.name: All Through the Night
31.description: Runyonesque Broadway gamblers turn patriotic when they stumble onto a cell of Nazi saboteurs.

32.name: Reap the Wild Wind
32.description: Florida ship salvager, Loxi, falls for Jack, captain of a ship wrecked on the Key West shore. However, their romance is complicated by the arrival of another suitor, and eventually leads to tragedy.

33.name: The Ghost of Frankenstein
33.description: When Ygor brings the Monster to Dr. Ludwig Frankenstein for care, Ludwig gets the idea of replacing the Monster's current criminal brain with a normal one.

34.name: The Man Who Came to Dinner
34.description: When acerbic critic Sheridan Whiteside slips on the front steps of a provincial Ohio businessman's home and breaks his hip, he and his entourage take over the house indefinitely.

35.name: White Cargo
35.description: The story takes place at a British plantation in Africa where Tondelayo entices all the Brits, especially Harry Witzel.

36.name: Road to Morocco
36.description: Two carefree castaways on a desert shore find an Arabian Nights city, where they compete for the luscious Princess Shalmar.

37.name: The First of the Few
37.description: Aircraft designer/patriot R. J. Mitchell, alarmed at growing German militarism, works to perfect a defense against the German Messerschmidt at the cost of his health.

38.name: This Above All
38.description: Although she comes from an aristocratic family, beautiful Prudence Cathaway defies convention by joining the WAAFs and becoming romantically involved with an AWOL soldier.

39.name: Tales of Manhattan
39.description: A formal tailcoat that gets passed from one owner to another affects each life in a significant way.

40.name: Desperate Journey
40.description: When the crew of a downed British bomber escape from their Nazi captors with Top Secret intelligence, they make a desperate journey to get out of Germany alive.

41.name: The Mummy's Tomb
41.description: A high priest travels to America with a living mummy to kill those who had desecrated the tomb of an Egyptian princess thirty years earlier.

42.name: Flying Tigers
42.description: Capt. Jim Gordon's command of the famed American mercenary fighter group in China is complicated by the recruitment of an old friend who is a reckless hotshot.

43.name: Eyes in the Night
43.description: A blind detective and his seeing-eye dog investigate a murder and discover a Nazi plot.

44.name: One of Our Aircraft Is Missing
44.description: When Nazi anti-aircraft fire damages a British bomber, its crew bails out and seeks help from the Dutch underground.

45.name: Across the Pacific
45.description: In December 1941, ex-army captain Rick Leland boards a Japanese ship heading to Asia via the Panama Canal where his Japanese hosts show interest in the American defense plans for the canal zone.

46.name: Tarzan's New York Adventure
46.description: Tarzan and Jane go to New York to rescue Boy after he is kidnapped into a circus.

47.name: Once Upon a Honeymoon
47.description: In Europe at the start of World War II, a woman notices that wherever her husband goes, the Nazis seem to follow. Meanwhile, a charming reporter is following them.

48.name: Keeper of the Flame
48.description: Journalist Steve O'Malley wants to write a biography of a national hero who died when his car ran off a bridge. Steve receives conflicting reports and tales that make him question what the truth about the hero is.

49.name: Sherlock Holmes and the Secret Weapon
49.description: Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Watson must protect a Swiss inventor of an advanced bomb sight from falling into German hands.

50.name: Went the Day Well?
50.description: An English village is occupied by disguised German paratroopers as an advance post for a planned invasion.
